summary:
You get light Mongol Female and Male Armor 
Mongol Great Scimitar 2H sword 
and Mongol Scimitar 1Handed sword
descriptionHtml:
================Update 12.02.2012 Addon Mongol Shield====================

This is addon for Mongol Armor Standalone
=========================================
1.Mongol Shield

You can buy and forge it at blacksmiths under studded section

1.Install with mod manager 

2.Manual instalation:

Copy the data folder to the main Skyrim folder where the TESV.exe is 
and overwrite all files when ask you to.

and check the MongolShield.esp in skyrim launcher

========================================================================================================
===================================Update___10.02.2012____ Mongol Armor Standalone version 2.0 
========================================================================================================

Sorry for all the problems i hope this will fix the problems for all.

Update the new Main File.

No need for any fixes.
All fixes Already in the version 2.0

and also a 1 handed scimitar with scabard  Mongol Scimitar

the 2.0 version is uplouded.

It has fixes for first person view and sword textures.
and also there is new sword 1handed scimitar.

so when the version 2.0 will be uplouded i will delate the 1.0 fix.

so there is realy no real point to download the fix for version 1.

i need to have a good starting main file to be adding some more things only like addons
not allways uploud the whole thing all over again.

i have plans if there will be interes

1.good round shield to match the stile of the armor and 1 handed scimitar.
2.some jewelry like amulets rings and armored circlets.
3.Maybe a matching bow and arrows.
4.Maybe some retexture of the horse armor
5.maybe some camp with couple of tents for home.
6.maybe some saber tiger and bear for the pet 

For the ones that have downloud the 1.0

just instal version 2.0 over the version 1.0
=======================================================================================
===================================Read this for Mongol Armor Standalone version 2.0
=======================================================================================


Male and Feamle Mongol Armor
================================================================================
What this mod does:
===========================================================
Import the *****Mongol Armor*****Male and Female
and the ****Mongol Great Scimitar****
and the ****Mongol Scimitar****

Installation Instructions:

1.Install with mod manager
===================================

2.Manual Installation:
==================================

3.Download Mongol Armor Standalone 1.0
====================================================================================
4. go to **(your user name)**\\Documents and Settings\\My Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim

open the SkyrimPrefs.ini with the notepad
and put this line under the [Launcher] section

bEnableFileSelection=1

3.Unpack the mod to a known location like (Desktop).
===========================================================
3.Find the folder labeled \'Data\' within the mods files.

Copy data folder to your Skyrim main folder where the TESV.exe is

When prompted by Windows if you would like to overwrite files with the same name
in the data folder located there answer, \"Yes To All\".

4.Start up Skyrim , 
======================
and place a checkmark next to 
MongolArmor.esp
in your Data files in your Skyrim Launcher.
It is the small window that open when you start Skyrim.

5. What You get:
=================

01.Mongol Armor___(Male and female Light Version)__studded section to forge
02.Mongol Gauntlets___(Male and female Light Version)__studded section to forge
03.Mongol Boots___(Male and female Light Version)__studded section to forge
04.Mongol Helmet___(Male and female Light Version)__studded section to forge

5.Mongol Great Scimitar_Steel section to forge___2Handed
6.Mongol Scimitar_Steel section to forge___1Handed with Scabard

6.Visit a smith and forge 
================================
1.Mongol Armor under the Studded section 
2.Mongol Great scimitar under the Steel section
============================================================== 
Or if you have some amount of money 
you can buy the stuff at next smithy merchants

- Riverwood
- Whiterun
- Makarath
- Solitude
- Windhelm
- Falkreath

7.Un-Installation Instructions
===================================

Remove the checkmark from MongolArmor.esp
 in the data files at start of the Skyrim launcher

If you would also like to remove the files

delate the folder Mongol from the data\\meshes\\armor
and the folder Mongol from the data\\textures\\armor
and the file MongolArmor.esp

======================================================
8. Credits:
==============
******Bethesda For Skyrim.
===============================
****Adonnay**** for making great swords i take some parts to make Great scimitar
=======================================================================================

9.Permision:
===========================
From me : Cokla
------------------
You can do with the mod whatever you like
=========================================
==============================================================================
Permissions from Adonnay:
==========================
the autor of the AdonnayClassical_Weaponry  Mod for Oblivion.
[url=http://www.tesnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=9185]LINK TO ORIGINAL MOD[/url]

Masage at Nexus Forums
==============================================
quote ******Cokla*****  To Adonnay


Hi.

These are real great swords you are making.

They would look real good in Skyrim.

Can you give me a permision to import them to the skyrim.

with full credits to you 
====================================================================

Quote *****Adonnay To Cokla******
======================================

Hey there,

Thanks. I think a simple port wouldn\'t be sufficient to make them look good in Skyrim. 
Most of the textures would probably need some tweaking (lighting is handled differently in Skyrim) 
and the blood meshes would have to be added (as far as I know). 
If you really want to do that, be my guest :)

Cheers
-Ad 
=========================================================================================

1
12.Tools used
==============
Nifskope
Adobe Photoshop
TESVSnip
Skyedit
author: Cokla
